Question: This person was an excellent dancer and frequently attended the theater, often referencing Shakespeare in letters.
Hints: King George III called this person "the greatest character of the age" because of this.
The first statue to show this person on horseback was dedicated in 1856 and is located in Manhattan's Union Square.
This person delivered the letter to the local French commander Jacques Legardeur de Saint-Pierre, who politely refused to leave.
